citations.narrative:
***Upon arrival at the facility there were many visitors in the park. USDA waited in the park observing interactions until the
facility representative arrived to accompany on inspection. During that time, more than 10 minutes, USDA observed
several children feeding the deer, llama and blackbuck. Some children were feeding by putting their hands through the
fence with feed in them while others were allowing the animals to eat out of the cups provided by the facility. The children
were able to pet the animal if it remained close to the fence. There are no physical barriers around the blackbuck, deer,
llama or Egyptian geese/crowned crane exhibits. The facility relies on having an attendant in the park monitoring while the
public is present so there are no permanent physical barriers around the blackbuck, deer, llama or Egyptian
geese/crowned crane exhibits. At no time during these interactions was there an attendant or facility staff member present
monitoring the public interactions with the animals.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals
and the public.
The absence of barriers between the public and animals, whether physical or attendants, does not minimize the risk of
harm to the animals or public. A barrier shall be provided to protect both animals and the public from harm.
Correct by May 31, 2024.

The enclosure housing the Egyptian geese, llama and crowned crane has murky green water. There is no drainage
system, aeration, filtration or overflow provided for the pool.
Pools or other aquatic areas without drainage systems must be aerated and have an incoming flow of fresh water or be
managed in a manner that maintains appropriate water quality in accordance with current professionally accepted
standards appropriate for the species.
The pool shall be cleaned and managed in a manner as required in this section.
Correct by May 31, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
